Reviews.Title: “great location, bed bug central.”
Reviews.Author: james d Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 2nd time ive stayed there, and i can tell you it will be my last. Hotel is in perfect location if u don't mind a lot of noise, which did'nt bother us as we were on a lads trip away. The reason i will never stay in this place is, !!!BED BUGS !!!came home wiith over 30 bites all over my body horrible manky place.

Reviews.Title: “mr”
Reviews.Author: scott m Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: do not go 2 this hostel not v gd at all its close two everthing but the room was very small my bedroom at home is bigger and this was for three of us and the bathroom was nastie shower curtain was broke and thay wasent interested in sorting it i had 2 wash the floor in the bedroom when i got there it was so slippery so dont go trust me

Reviews.Title: “Average Place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Su K
Reviews.Content: Me and four friends stayed here for 4 nights, aged between 19-22, stairs were not a nice thing to climb when you're on top floor, especially if you've got heavy baggage. Overall i think we must have got a good deal compared to most people giving the reviews on here because our room was fine, nice view, clean enough, not a bad size, brilliant location and comfy beds, i can see why some people are complaining but i guess i'm just not fussy. only real problems were the stairs and the shower which was basically just a shower in a small cupboard with a glass pane on the door so you could see the person in it, we just put a towel up and it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Steep Stairs (ladder-like), Small Room (box-like) ..Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Mother4
Reviews.Content: The room was like a box and with no elevator, was hard bringing luggage up the ladder...err stairs. Only bonus, location, location, location..in the heart of Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely overpriced”
Reviews.Author: adzthealien
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for quality and value, do yourself a favor and avoid this place. I'm a low-maintenance traveler, so the flaws of this place didn't bother me that much, but the price was completely unwarranted and I definitely wouldn't recommend staying here if you're looking for something cheap OR nice. The shower door was broken and the shower itself offered no privacy - it's in full view of the room with only a clear door to separate it. Our room was up on one of the highest floors, and we were offered no help with our luggage. The staff were not very helpful and didn't seem interested in their jobs at all. The only upsides were the free wifi and the great location - right in the middle of everything. However, that definitely didn't make it worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Paula M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Continel in there"best room", This Hotel was extremely overpriced , our room was on the fourth floor the stairs are very steep some of the steps are broken and you have to crouch at certain parts of the stairs. Our mattress was too small for the bed , the duvet cover barely covered both of us , our so called pillows were raggedy cushions every time we went to have a shower there was no water the shower door didnt work the stench in the bathroom was revolting, the staff were unhelpful , while we knew this was a budget hotel the price we paid and what we got was well below standard

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ant079
Reviews.Content: the service was average, can't make any complaints there! The room was a bit cramped but then it is a budget hotel and there were 4 of us in it, only problem was that it was on the top floor and the stairs were very steep but it did come with a nice view. The beds were also comfey and there was a shower. The location was excellent, about a minutes walk from the main shopping area, the central station and the red light district, was a bit far to walk to the clubs though. it didn't provide breakfast but there was a lovely vegetarian takeaway next door which was very well priced. Its value was great, cheaper than what some people we had met payed for a hostel!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AVOID AVOID (Flee bitten, Smelly, overpriced hell hole)”
Reviews.Author: 186337Russell77
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at Hotel Continental, Amsterdam we were greeted with the prospect of no electricity for our entire stay!!! We said this wasnâ€™t good enough and would seek alternative accommodation and were told by this horrible man if we did that our card would be charged for a 50% cancellation (abt 200 Euro) Therefore after arguing for abt 15 minutes, out of no where a room became available with electricity!!! On entering our room which was 3 stories high (abt 150 stairs) there was a disgusting smell like smoothing had died there. The room was tiny the view was of a grey slate dirty roof and the walls were so thin we could hear everything in the next room. We tried to spend every minute out that hell hole. When we woke the next morning we were covered in flee bites and we itched for the duration of our stay. The shower was filthy the toilet hardly flushed. We have never stayed in such a disgusting overpriced place and would say to all, AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE. On a positive note Amsterdam Is a great place but accommodation ruined our stay!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “want better - pay more!!”
Reviews.Author: carobenn
Reviews.Content: If your going to amsterdam for the romantic side of things the canal trips, museum's, galleries,candle lit dinners, you shouldnt even be looking at this budget hotel, its not for you !! If your going to amsterdam to party its great, brilliant location, right in the heart of things! Bedding and towels clean, room is small but you only going to sleep in it, stairs are steep but thats just the architecture, every building has got to have the steep stairs! To really appreciate this hotel, visit a coffee shop en route!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel!”
Reviews.Author: naminami1108
Reviews.Content: Dirty yellowish sheets and the smallest room I've ever stayed (even much smaller than the one I stayed in Tokyo, japan. Poor infrastructures and a very old building! My door couldn't be locked properl and it was very noisy during the night.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever been in!”
Reviews.Author: donnasdirectory
Reviews.Content: What a dirty stinking place! Horrible steep stairs! Rat traps under bed! Cramped rooms and saggy tiny beds. You would be better off sleeping in the street!

Reviews.Title: “Please, please go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: JohnBarton_11
Reviews.Content: This place is a small dark dinge hotel that a squatter would avoid. Mouse traps under bed on the second floor, if you make it up that far climbing the steep broken steps. Itâ€™s being decorated at moment (if you can call a single layer of paint that), so it noisy during the day, and due to location does not get quite until gone 3am at night. Please, do yourself a favour and find somewhere else to stay, that will be cheaper and I promise cannot be any worse.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid , Avoid, Avoid”
Reviews.Author: richiejones1977
Reviews.Content: Do not ever stay in this hotel, if you want dirty rooms, smelly bed linen, mouse traps under the beds, and a room the size of an iraq prison cell then this is the hotel for you. Even if this hotel was free i wouldn`t stay in it. The stairs are so steep on all levels that after just 2 pints you`d struggle to climb up. If there was ever a fire in this hotel theres no way you`d get out. Just the image off google street view should be enough to put you off. Free wi fi was nowhere to be seen, and the TVS in the three rooms we stayed in were all positioned so that when in bed you couldn`t see them... Avoid Avoid Avoid....

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Nasty...but not even that cheap”
Reviews.Author: gb7547
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much when we booked this hotel but even at that we were disappointed. The reception staff were rude, the stairs were dangerously steep, the room was smelly and not clean and our bathroom door had a whole punched in it! Amsterdam was lovely but we will not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Strouddy
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" is horrific. It is dirty, it smells, it's cold and to be avoided at all costs. Even as a male student my son was appalled by the state of this place. And they wanted to charge Euros126 per night! the allocated room was up a steep, narrow and dangerous stair case. The bathroom was disgusting with previous guests 'body hair' still in the shower and on the floor. Although there may have been heating it certainly was not on! The sheets were grey and un-inviting. 4 nights were booked at this hovel, but the lads checked out after only 1 and that is only because they were going to be charged for that night whether they stayed there or not!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: macca6771
Reviews.Content: I have never ever been to such a shocking hotel. Miserable service at reception, stairs si narrow and steep and broken...no lifts. Rooms are an absolute disgrace, TV was hanging off the wall and the room was so small you could barely get your case in. Linen was awful, toilets and showers dirty - never ever stay here!

Reviews.Title: “RUN AWAY AS FAST AS YOU CAN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: spacebound
Reviews.Content: Upon entering, my shoes stuck to the floor, The room smelled like a toilet. You would seriously be better off sleeping under a urinal...that might at least smell lemony....Anyhow, being a plumber, even i couldn't handle the stank....The workers made me pay cash and there are NO REFUNDS.....I came down after 2 hours at the most to complain....i was told there were no more rooms.....just then, 2 people walked in and got rooms......SPENT MY LAST 70 EUROS THERE and my train left at 7 in the morning.........I walked around broke for 10 1/2 hours. My advice is don't get a room, just make sure you buy supllies before 1 in the morning and save your money peace

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO 2 THIS SO CALLED HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: cjbullion
Reviews.Content: This was supposed 2 be our honeymoon! the bed wasnt big enough 2 fit us both on,our window had bars on and opened up onto a courtyard that had extractor fans blowin hot air n a stink in! we asked 2 change rooms, we had 2 share a bathroom and got no kind of compensation! The place is dirty and has rat poison under the beds! Oh and to top it off they dont tell u about CITY TAX till u get there! The only reason we stayed is because we cudnt afford another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but think 2x”
Reviews.Author: wtgn_ling
Reviews.Content: Booked a triple room for a 5D trip with sister & her friend. We are small-built but still find the room rather tight, toilet also quite small with mouldy ceiling & unlockable doors. We had three mice coming into the room for our croissant in the middle of the night. Don't remember mice were included in our booking of the room. We kept food out of our room for the subsequent nights and the problem was gone. Staff took our empty bottle on the table (we had intentions for other use) without our knowledge., and towels provided are nowhere near the good standards. Hotel is well-located in the prime district, so food/sights/shopping is never a problem and but morning traffic can be annoying if you are not an early person. Problem about steep stairs are known before arriving so not much of a surprise, just brace yourself for it. Owner said they will be refurbishing the hotel next year and convert to a hostel. Overall, not too bad an accommodation if you do not have high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, nice view”
Reviews.Author: Karin80
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very top location, you can reach everywhere of city center on foot in less than 10 minutes. The room I stayed has a very nice city view -- typical Amsterdam's canal houses.

Reviews.Title: “dont go”
Reviews.Author: mark332
Reviews.Content: Would not go back to this hotel There were mouse traps under the bed very dirty rooms and the stairs were somethin else very steepe .

Reviews.Title: “Do you want be disappointed?”
Reviews.Author: user-marcel
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Amsterdam to spend weekend with friends. We booked triple-bed room for 3 nights mostly due to good location in city center. Immediately after our arrival to hotel we were asked to pay whole bill which is at least unusual. Terminal in reception didn't accepted two valid credit cards, so we had to pay in cash. Room was on third floor, but steep stairs made it looked like on seventh. Although we arrived two hours after check-in, we had to wait for another hour until the room was cleaned by the man who was apparently to high to be able to change bedclothes after 15 minutes smiling & babbling. At least we was able to face up shock after we entered room. Room was dark, dirty, no closet and tiny shower without light - 100% opposite to shiny photos on hotel web page. Instead of 3 beds there was only two, our complains were unsuccessful. We spent one whole night only with hunt on cockroach. Sleeping was hard thing to do, thin walls didn't filter a word from other rooms. One of us decided to leave to another hotel after first night, two of us stayed till end because we were on low budget. This hotel which will bury all hopes you have about accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: TerryFW
Reviews.Content: The price for our 4 night stay would have not kept us in entertainment for a night (ok thats a lie but it 2 nights doesn't seem so shocking). The room was tiny but I have paid more to sleep in one smaller. The service was at worse curt but at best very pleasent. The location rocks, I can't think of a negative side to it, you have all you probably need right on your doorstep. Your will definately want some good ear plugs, luckily we had already picked up on that thanks to this site but while you might get a room somwhere quiet our room (facing the alley, No 27, with the toilet and shower right opposite) was quite noisy, we kind of liked it... but we had ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “dreadfull”
Reviews.Author: baglanjeff
Reviews.Content: its got to be the worst hotel ive ever stayed in.the rooms were cell like dark noisey ,the stairs are something else ,whats more we had to pay up front for our four nights ,the cant be bothered to get off there backsides to help you with your bags

Reviews.Title: “A GOOD BASIC HOTEL FOR YOUR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandDunroamin
Reviews.Content: First i must add a comment, i always check this website for any places i am looking at booking BUT always bear in mind that out of the hundreds upon thosands that stay in these hotels only a small minority unfortnatly for them have a bad experience, nobodys perfect!!! Anyway back to my recent stay at this hotel. For our wedding Anniversary we decided to visit Amsterdam for its history and Culture, this being my Husbands first time here.This hotel is very basic but clean, Friendly staff, we only paid 65 euros a night for a double bedroom,with shared facilitles, although we were surprised to find that we had our own shower. We stayed in room 25 at the top of the very steep stairs (you are in Amsterdam) which was 2 feet away from the toilet. The location of this hotel is perfect as it is central to everything. We will return to this hotel on our next visit without question. Amsterdam itself has many things for all tastes, we did historic days out, The sex museum, Window shopping a the red light district etc

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here as a last resort”
Reviews.Author: deb899
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend that you don't stay here. The whole place smells of smoke, the stairs are so steep and there is no lift. Also the rooms are tiny and the bathrooms are dirty and small. The location is good however it is really noisy at night as the windows don't close properly. Also our tv was broken and when I told them they did not fix it. The matresses were really old and dirty. I really suggest that you don't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Clean and Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: missliana
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in a room with a double bed and shared bathroom and shower and it was very nice! I am a student so the price was good and the room was clean. Its minimal inside, but the location was brilliant! A five minute walk from central station it was easy to find, and at the centre of great places to eat and shop. The red light district was a 10 minute walk away as well as other attractions such as anne franks house and several museums. The staff were very friendly, informative and helpful and I enjoyed my stay. (if you are not traveling lightly I dont advise this hotel, due to the fact there was no elevator and the tiny stairs to each floor were very steep.) Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, treacherous stairs!”
Reviews.Author: lig1986
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel is amazing! couldnt get much better really, but be warned THERES NO LIFT AND VERY STEEP STAIRS!!! we were on the 4th floor and it was very difficlut get suitcases up the stairs and we were offered no help. The room was ok, comfy beds bt afew broken things in the room. The shower in our room was actually part of the room, it had no door so u cud see people in the shower and considering it was a triple room this was abit difficult. Overall was a good hotel mostly because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you can help it! Save yourself the pain!”
Reviews.Author: Struba
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in anywhere. I would not advise anyone to stay here. We arrived at around 11pm and were booked for two nights. We left by 9:30am the following morning after I had found another hotel to stay in. (Which was fantastic) Our room was on the 4th floor. A warning to all- the stair are EXTREMELY steep. It was a real struggle lugging the luggage up and down. The room was filthy, the bed sheets and blankets were stained with something 'yellow', bed was unusable (we had to move the mattress, which was also heavily stained, to the floor so we would have something to sleep on) The fire detector was blocked up with paper. This was obviously done to allow customers to smoke in the room and from about 7am the smell of smoke was apparent in the hotel. This didn't give us any comfort as our room was in the attic on the 4th floor and there is no sprinkler system of fire escape. Bathroom was tiny and full of mould. The shower door was also broken. WiFi didn't work in the room (I needed it to look for another hotel) The receptionist on duty was incredibly rude when I complained. He had absolutely no interest in rectifying any issues and just denied that there was anything wrong. All this for the pleasure of paying about 200 Euro a night!!! ok, now the good stuff Location. That's it. However there are about 50 more hotels in the area which I would look at first.

Reviews.Title: “bitten to bits, and hilariously small”
Reviews.Author: hangirl
Reviews.Content: ok, so booked this based on the price (290 euro for 4 nights) and the location - which is fantastic. then i read the reviews on here. and started to sweat a bit. when we got there, it seemed really cute - but its old. the room we were given was so small that when we tried to turn the bed round (to be able to open the window) we had to put it on its side to get it round the corner of the room. then there was the bites. they started on the third night - had we awakened something? - and by the time we came home, i was covered in them. they are like flea bites, not mozzy bites (which seem to weep if you itch them, these don't) so i'm not sure what they are. but i don't expect to get bitten by anything really. then there's the bathroom facilities - a door you had to slam to force it shut, a shower in a cupboard with a stinky curtain. whilst we were there it didn't seem that bad - but now i'm home, it hits how hilarious it really was. if you're used to travelling outside of europe, this is nothing, but if you want a HOTEL, don't bother!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 8143jess
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend anyone to stay at this hotel . This hotel was not worth the money, we stayed there for 5 nights and it was awful. Our room was the size of a shoe box, we were supposed to have a double bed but it was more like a single bed. They even charged us 5% to us a debit card to pay for the hotel it does not state this in any of the terms and conditions absolute rip off. We were woken up every morning early to see if we wanted house cleaning, why the could not wait until we left the hotel I don't know as we were out by 10 am every morning. They only left us one towel between the two of us to use, and I would not say they even cleaned the room when we were out.

Reviews.Title: “very bad”
Reviews.Author: frotrik
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night, any I can't see any reason to give a recommandation.The hotel is close to the station, but it smells, is dirty and very noisy. Our room was extremely small, there was no place to move at all.The window didn't open, the air in the room was bad, the walls were dirty, the towels had holes and weren't really clean.The walls seemed to be extremely thin, and there were all kind of noises and sounds all day and night.The price we paid was not justified, since there was no service at all.

Reviews.Title: “The most depressing place I have ever been.”
Reviews.Author: Right_to_arm_bears
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 10:30 at night absolutely exhausted but the place was so dingy, smelly, depressing and gross that I immediately went to a bar to get myself tired enough to minimise my waking hours in this horrendous hell-pit. I was there on business and it quickly became obvious that the main clientele in this hotel are visiting to explore the red light district so the hotel knew that cleanliness is not their major factor when deciding which hotel to book. The first morning I had to ask them to sort out the smell on my corridor, the second morning I discovered that my shared bathroom had been puked all over. Probably a good place to stay if you like prostitutes and sleeping in filth, not so great for anybody else.

Reviews.Title: “Pokey, dirty and smelly”
Reviews.Author: Crongmor
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on a Dutch website and was persuaded by an average rating of 6.8. This rating is thoroughly unwarranted. The first thing I noticed was the hotel frontage being plastered in pigeon guana. In the reception (smelling of chips and cannabis smoke) I was informed that payment (â‚¬325 for 3 nights) must be in advance, which I have never encountered before. Then had to take heavy luggage up two ladder-like staircases (no offers of assistance and no lift) to my second floor room. Door to room was unvarnished plywood and would have looked more at home on a portacabin. The room number plaque was cracked in two. Inside the room was dark and very small. Linoleum floor. Two rickety wooden chairs/ table and a tiny wardrobe with one hanger. Small TV. Window view was another wall. Shower and toilet acceptable (yes, surprising, but yes). Bedhead put against hot radiator (what is the logic behind that - tourists in Amsterdam like sweaty heads?). Scab-like stain (blood/ ketchup?) on ceiling. Double bed very small and saggy. On the 2nd night my wife complained of itching in bed and I too got a bad itching and rash on the 3rd night. On our last morning, the morning after the daylight saving time shift, we were rudely awakened by a key turning in the lock and an unfriendly lady telling us we have to check out now, pointing at her watch, showing 10.05 am. I was given a good idea of what Idi Amin's sister would be like. Really charming stuff! The worst part was this hotel isn't even cheap. Booking 7 weeks in advance we were paying â‚¬108 per night which, back in England, I would expect to secure a family room plus breakfast in a half decent hotel. The lack of comfort, the sense of being ripped off and the lack of any attempt at service thoroughly ruined my first trip to Amsterdam. In response to the positive comments I cannot imagine how anyone could be unoffended by this "hotel". Maybe that's just Amsterdam for you. I suspect it might be and so I am not going there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scotsguy5
Reviews.Content: We normally stay in the Leidseplein area but couldn't get booked anywhere and took the Continental as the last available with a triple room. The location is great, just 2 minutes from Centraal Sation - literally 2 mins. The room was small for 3 people but we were only sleeping in it- so no problems. The hotel was clean and there was housekeeping every day. We had en-suite and the shower room was great. Didn't partake of the breakfast (7 Euros extra). reception is manned 24 hours which is great because you don;t have to worry about losing your keys. It was a bit more expensive that we usually pay (Â£41 each per night for 3 of us - 5% credit card charge on top of rate so best to pay cash) but the location more than made up for that and we did book late. The only down side to the hotel was that its location means it is noisy - very noisy at times, not from the hotel itself - we didn't hear anything from other guests but the streets in the area are noisy 24 hours a day so if you can't take noise maybe ask for a room at the back (don't know if they are less noisy or not) or find somewhere quiet. I would definitely us this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: manzdavz
Reviews.Content: i was vrey impressed with this hotel, after reading other reviews left by previous customers i was a bit apprehensive, but our room was much better than we expected, we even got an en suite (which we hadn't booked), room was very clean, staff were very friendly and the price was ridiculously cheap. only one or two complaints to make about this hotel - cleaners insisting on cleaning the room at around 10 each morning, eventhough we had our 'do not disturb' signs up (we were on a 21st birthday trip, and were having pretty late nights), stairs were hideously steep, narrow and uneven (made more of a problem for me as i had fallen over and hurt both my knees badly), we were on the top floor, and there was no alternative means of getting to our room. my boyfriend and i went to amsterdam in august 2006, and stayed in the hotel old quarter, which all in all, was not value for money, considering the price we paid for our TINY room. all in all i was very impressed with this hotel and would deffinately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than i expected”
Reviews.Author: nursemeggan
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews left by others and was afraid of what I would get upon my arrival to the Continental Hotel in Amsterdam. I am 46 and I traveled with 5 children 18-22 years old. This was a graduation gift from Mom. I walked the short distance from the train station only 5-10 min walk. When i saw the sign and went in the man at the desk was soo nice and helpful. I got a room on the first floor which was up aprox. 20 steps my 3 sons all 18-19 years old got a room on the 4th floor they can climb better than me. Our room was an ensuite which had a bathroom inside. The boys shared a bathroom with other guests. My room was very clean, linens very clean. I was surprised that the bathroom was spotless. We even had shampoo,bath gel and a hair dryer. The room is great for 18-30 year olds. The location walking distance to everything. The children loved it. My daughter 22 years old said it was better than most Hostels she had stayed in. I think this was a fun hotel for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Cheap and cheerful(ish)”
Reviews.Author: deno666
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and it is cheap. The rooms were clean and the staff were friendly. However the only problem was that the walls are paper thin and so we could hear everything going on in the hall. It probably didn't help that we were in the room right by the stairs of first floor and so near reception but i think in general the walls were very thin. Apart from that i didn't have any problems. the rooms were very small but i expected that and they were clean which is the main thing. the en-suite shower and toilet worked fine. overall it was ok, it was cheap, breakfast is not included but the only problem was the noise. even though the hotel itself wasnt noisy it was just the fact that the walls were so thin that it was a struggle to sleep. if you want a cheap place in a good location that is clean then this is fine. but if you want peace and quiet i wouldn't recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Gerthrud
Reviews.Content: We, 2 girls from Latvia, stayed there 2 nights, everything was fine, bed clean, everything quite small but SO excellent location that you can reach EVERYTHING you wish and staff was helpful and shower clean as well as toilets. We forgot shoes and got them back in a next days because of obliging and understanding staff. For such a price and location its a place we recommend. Not for a spoiled ones. Suitable for real, easy going, flexible and perhaps adventurous travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Continental”
Reviews.Author: bloden2
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Amsterdam - my girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Continental. I was pretty skeptical after reading these reviews; however, my experience exceeded my incredibly low expectations. There is an automatic door and a short funny asian man when you walk into the tiny lobby. He is helpful however this hotel is very limited in resources . No internet, no computer, only a phonebook and a few flyers. The night audit guy just got hammered, blacked out on the ground all night, and refused to help with any questions. The whole place smells like lo mein in the morning because everyone goes to the really good asian place called lemongrass wok or soemthing like that and then i guess leaves it in their room overnight. There is a pretty sweet vending machine - everything in it is warm and costs 2 euros You can hear everything going on, next to your room, outside, etc The bed is really comfortable There is no shower or toilet in the room, its outside in the hall reallly good coffeeshop right next door and a place that sells mushrooms - definetely a good location I woulndt bring any valuables because anyone can just walk in and out of this place bc the door opens automatically and then u just have to give them a room number and they give u ur key. Was fun, wouldnt stay more than 1 or 2 nights though.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to be excited about, but does the job!”
Reviews.Author: hea27
Reviews.Content: Cost: â‚¬250 for 3 nights (end March 06) (online booking site) Location: excellent, mid way on damrak, 5 min from main train station, RL district, some sites Room: OK, fairly clean and comfortable bed, certainly not anything flash, very basic, quite old, 3 single beds in a small room with window, wardrobe and tv Bathroom: private bathroom, very clean and spacious, fairly old Service: we didn't really need much but there was always someone on the desk and our booking/checking in was smooth Reception: very narrow steep stair case, no lift Breafast: didn't try, McDonalds nearby with great breakfast croissants! Pros: location, bathtub Cons: staircase/no lift, budget room

Reviews.Title: “Anyone that thought this place was Ok was either stoned or paid considerably les”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you pay 30Euros a night per room than you get what you have paid for I suppose, which is why some people are saying how great this place was. It IS in a fantastic location (especially if you are a weed smoking chinese food fan). If you pay anything more than this though you will not be happy with it - neither will you if you have any problems sleeping on a sloping bed/sleeping in someone elses bodily fluids/wrestling cockroaches/climbing 100 stairs with your suitcase - I did my neck in. The room looks like a students room who left home 20 years ago as a teenager and took his sheets and curtains from FADS with him. Tips: - Take a harness or strap to keep you from rolling out of the bed - Dont eat the breakfast - Buy a "stairmaster" exercise machine and work out on it for 6 months before you go - Sleep in the cupboard under the stairs at home for a month before you go to get used to the size of the room - Take flip flops for in the shower - Take a sleeping bag and pillow - Get absolutely smashed before returning to your room and leave it before you sober up in the morning - Dont waste your time being polite to the staff - the cleaner even demanded cash to carry my suitcase down the stairs after i injured my neck carrying it up them. - Dont visit a massage parlour to sooth your stiff neck

Reviews.Title: “Ever seen a cockroach with Antlers on its head?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ah, the Hotel Continental. We booked this Hotel fairly late and felt relieved having found somewhere to stay. The secret behind why it was the only place in Amsterdam left vacant was soon revealed. To this day, I am surprised that a room (which l would be more at home on a canal boat, being around 9ft square) cost 120 Euros per night. Especially given it had no toilet or shower. I ended up with the bed on the right hand side of the room. With the 30-degree gradient of the floor, gravity forced me that way. I could see that getting to the other side would almost certainly require special equipment. I unpacked my case and placed three t-shirts in the wardrobe, taking half of the 12inch capacity before sitting down on my bed (shelf). It felt a little hard so I pulled back the cigarette burned sheet to reveal the heavily stained "mattress". Clair Raynor flogs maxi pads thicker than what we had to sleep on. I suppose the good thing about being on my side of the slant though meant that I rolled into the wall. Instead of the floor. Thank the Lord for small blessings. Enough about my room though- we got chatting to some people during our stay who told us about their room, which came free with a little friend, Rudolf. Rudolf the Red nosed Cockroach (so named because of his Antler like tentacles) I asked how they found the place apart from that and they mentioned they'd been trying to get friendly with the South African reception guy the night before. They asked his name in a friendly way to which he replied sternly "I don't give anyone my name!" How warm. Oh and If you get cold during your stay at Hotel Continental, why not knit a nice jumper from the pubic hair you'll find in the shared showers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It cost 55 Euros per night for 2 adults. Excellent location â€“ within walking distance from the Central Station and Damark Strip. Many restaurants within walking distance. Rooms are small, very basic but also nice and clean. Staff was friendly. Agree with the other reviewer that hotel may not be suitable for a romantic trip, but it is perfect if you just look for a place to sleep while exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Continental saved our lives......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i spent new years eve 04/05 in Amsterdam with 2 friends and had nowhere to stay on arrival,to cut a long story short we ended up staying in the Continental. 1) Good location (as said before) 2)Cheap (we paid Â£30 pp on NYE ;) 3)Found the staff to be ok 4)Cleanish room 5)You can puff in the rooms:) only 3 bad things... 1)Room did smell like chow mein:( 2)No en suite (ok maybe a bit much to ask for for Â£30 :) 3)Stairs are steep but arent they all like that in Amsterdam?

Reviews.Title: “a good resting den”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: a clean room and a very good location. the only real problem was the television didnt work and the stairs were a nightrmare. a excellent location if you want to just smoke puff all day.opposite is the grasshopper coffee shop and bar. the red light district is just across the street. not a good choice if you want a peacefull nights rest.

Reviews.Title: “A Stinker”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location along the Damrak strip is the only plus factor. The room was small and stuffy, made worse by the fact that we had to put up with the smell of cooking from the restaurants below. The service staff were aloof and did not make us feel welcomed at the hotel. We also paid 90+ euros per night for what was a less than one star accomodation. Definitely would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location: For anyone who knows amsterdam this Hotel is on the Damrak opposite the Grasshopper. For anyone who has not been to Dam before this Hotel is based on the Damrak which is the main strip through town. It is a few minutes walk from Central Station (trams & trains), the main shopping area, Dam Square and about 5 mins walk from the Red Light District. Facilities: My room was clean and tidy but very basic. I was left with no power for a couple of hours one night and there is no catering apart from breakfast and a vending machine in the lobby. Verdict: As I was only there for two nights holidaying on my own this hotel was perfect as the location is right in the middle of the busiest part of town and was afterall only for sleeping in. If however you are considering this hotel for a romantic trip to Amsterdam or you plan to spend a lot of time in your room then you may want to re-consider.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Continental
HotelInfo.Address: Damrak 40-41, Amsterdam 1012 LK, The Netherlands
